v.v: The gold has become tarnished; how the purest gold has changed!
The precious sons of Zion were worth their weight in pure gold,
Even the jackals offer the breast to nurse their cubs, but
The tongue of the nursing baby sticks to the roof of his mouth by thirst;
Those who used to feast on the finest food now starve in the streets.
The punishment of the daughter of my people is greater than that of Sodom,
Her leaders were purer than snow, whiter than milk;
Their appearance now is darker than soot;
Those who have been killed by the sword were happier than those killed by hunger,
The hands of compassionate women have boiled their own children;
Yahweh showed all his wrath; he poured out his fierce anger.
The kings of the earth did not believe,
This happened because of the sins of her prophets and the iniquities of her priests
They wandered, blind, through the streets.
“Away! Unclean!” people cried at them. “Away! Away! Do not touch!”
Yahweh himself scattered them; he does not watch over them anymore.
Our eyes failed, looking in vain for help;
They followed our steps,
Our pursuers were swifter than the eagles in the sky.
The breath in our nostrils—Yahweh’s anointed one—he was the one who was captured in their pits;
Rejoice and be glad, daughter of Edom,
Daughter of Zion, your punishment will come to an end;

v: The holy stones are scattered at the corner of every street.
but now they are worth no more than clay jars, the work of the potter’s hands!
the daughter of my people has become cruel, like the ostriches in the desert.
the children ask for food, but there is none for them.
Those who were brought up wearing scarlet clothing now lie on piles of ashes.
which was overthrown in a moment and no hands were wrung for her.
their bodies were more ruddy than coral, their form was like sapphire.
they are not recognized in the streets.
Their skin has shriveled on their bones;
it has become as dry as wood.
who wasted away, pierced by the lack of any harvest from the field.
they became their food during the time
when the daughter of my people was being destroyed.
He kindled a fire in Zion that consumed her foundations.
nor did any of the inhabitants of the world believe,
that enemies or opponents could enter the gates of Jerusalem.
who have shed the blood of the righteous in her midst.
They were so defiled by that blood that no one was allowed to touch their clothes.
So they wandered about; people said among the nations, “They can stay here no longer.”
They do not honor the priests,
and they did not show any favor to the elders.
from our watchtowers we watched
for a nation that could not rescue us.
we could not walk in our streets.
Our end was near and our days were numbered,
our end had come.
They chased us to the mountains and lay in wait for us in the wilderness.
of whom it was said, “Under his shadow we will live among the nations.”
you who live in the land of Uz.
But to you also the cup will be passed;
you will be drunk and strip yourself naked.
he will not extend your exile.
But daughter of Edom, he will punish;
he will uncover your sins.
